graph_elements.nodes¶

Test docstring (module-level). This module contains various node definitions for an energy network.

class graph_elements.nodes.Gas(name, power_output, co2_per_mw, ramp_up_time, capital_cost, lcoe)[source]¶

A gas-powered source node.

Parameters:

  • name (Hashable) – A unique identifier for the gas node.

  • power_output (list or callable) – Hourly power output (MW) for gas generation.

  • co2_per_mw (float) – CO2 emissions per MW generated by gas.

  • ramp_up_time (callable) – A function defining how quickly the gas source can ramp up to full capacity.

  • capital_cost (float) – Initial investment cost for the gas installation.

  • lcoe (float) – Levelized Cost of Electricity ($/MWh) for gas.

class graph_elements.nodes.Node(node_id)[source]¶

A basic node in the energy network.

Parameters:

node_id (Hashable) – A unique identifier for the node.

node_id¶

The node’s identifier.

Type:

Hashable

connections¶

A list of connections leading from this node to other nodes.

Type:

list

class graph_elements.nodes.SinkNode(node_id, demand_profile, lcoe_requirement)[source]¶

Represents a power demand location (e.g., city, town).

Parameters:

  • node_id (Hashable) – A unique identifier for the sink node.

  • demand_profile (list or callable) – Hourly power demand (MW). If a list, indexed by hour; if callable, called with an hour integer as the argument.

  • lcoe_requirement (float) – Minimum required Levelized Cost of Electricity ($/MWh).

get_demand(hour)[source]¶

Returns the power demand at a specified hour.

Parameters:

hour (int) – The hour of interest (e.g., 0 = midnight, 1 = 1 AM, etc.).

Returns:

The demand in MW at the given hour.

Return type:

float

class graph_elements.nodes.Solar(name, power_output, capital_cost, lcoe)[source]¶

A solar power source node.

Parameters:

  • name (Hashable) – A unique identifier for the solar node.

  • power_output (list or callable) – Hourly power output (MW) specific to solar production.

  • capital_cost (float) – Initial investment cost for the solar installation.

  • lcoe (float) – Levelized Cost of Electricity ($/MWh) for solar.

class graph_elements.nodes.SourceNode(node_id, power_output, dispatchability, co2_per_mw, ramp_up_time, capital_cost, lcoe, deployment_time)[source]¶

Base class for energy sources.

Parameters:

  • node_id (Hashable) – A unique identifier for the source node.

  • power_output (list or callable) – Hourly power output (MW). If a list, indexed by hour; if callable, called with an hour integer as the argument.

  • dispatchability (float) – A value in [0, 1] indicating how flexible the source is in adjusting output.

  • co2_per_mw (float) – CO2 emissions per MW generated.

  • ramp_up_time (callable) – A function defining how quickly the source can ramp up to full capacity.

  • capital_cost (float) – Initial investment cost of the source.

  • lcoe (float) – Levelized Cost of Electricity ($/MWh).

  • deployment_time (int or float) – Time (in some unit, e.g., years) required to deploy the source.

get_power_output(hour)[source]¶

Returns the power output at a specified hour.

Parameters:

hour (int) – The hour for which to retrieve output.

Returns:

The power output (MW) at the given hour.

Return type:

float

class graph_elements.nodes.Wind(name, power_output, capital_cost, lcoe)[source]¶

A wind power source node.

Parameters:

  • name (Hashable) – A unique identifier for the wind node.

  • power_output (list or callable) – Hourly power output (MW) specific to wind production.

  • capital_cost (float) – Initial investment cost for the wind installation.

  • lcoe (float) – Levelized Cost of Electricity ($/MWh) for wind.
